place.name: Y FAENOR
place.gazetteerText: VAINOR, a parish, with a village and three hamlets, in the district of Merthyr-Tydviland county of Brecon; on the river Taff, 4 miles N by E of Merthyr-Tydvil r. station. Post town, Merthyr-Tydvil. Acres, 6,597. Real property, £4,548. Pop. in 1851, 2,667; in 1861, 2,984. Houses, 649. The surface includes some very fine scenery. There are coal mines and ironworks. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £265.* Patron, not reported. The church is old; and a tumulus adjoins it. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
